sentences.english: The wisdom of Banpo people shouldn't be underestimated.
sentences.chinese: 这半坡人的智慧可真不能小觑啊。

sentences.english: However, the support and motivation of incorruption system by the incorruption culture can not be underestimated.
sentences.chinese: 但是，廉政文化对制度反腐的支持和推动力不容小觑。

sentences.english: But neither should anyone minimize the problems confronting us.
sentences.chinese: 但也不应小觑我们面临的问题。

sentences.english: The importance of the amide bond in science cannot be overstated.
sentences.chinese: 酰胺键的重要性不容小觑的科学。

sentences.english: It is an awesome power to be able to tax the biggest and most prosperous economy in the world.
sentences.chinese: 向世界上最大和最繁荣的经济体征税的权力不可小觑。

sentences.english: The scale of the modernisation challenge facing the PRC should not be underestimated.
sentences.chinese: 中国在现代化过程中面临的挑战不容小觑。

sentences.english: Yet we must never underestimate sin's deadliness.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们绝不可小觑罪的严重性。

sentences.english: Simultaneously they summon the ability which the monster beast helps in the fighting also are cannot be belittled.
sentences.chinese: 同时他们召唤妖兽助战的能力也是不可小觑的。

sentences.english: The threat from North Korean military forces, moreover, “cannot be taken lightly”.
sentences.chinese: 此外，朝鲜军事力量的威胁不可小觑。

sentences.english: The political argument in favour of reform is strong.
sentences.chinese: 支持政治改革的理由是不容小觑的。

sentences.english: The ripple effects arising from China’s deflating housing sector cannot be underestimated.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们不能小觑中国楼市紧缩的带来的涟漪效应。

sentences.english: The profitability of a product should never take a hit.
sentences.chinese: 产品的可盈利性永远不能小觑。

sentences.english: We should never underestimate the issue of theme.
sentences.chinese: 千万别小觑了这区区的题材小事。

sentences.english: That is a not-so-trivial benefit of open source.
sentences.chinese: 这是开源的一个不可小觑的益处。

sentences.english: China is also being cited as the coming force in universities.
sentences.chinese: 中国大学的潜力也不可小觑。

sentences.english: But Fiat also has an influential supporter.
sentences.chinese: 但是菲亚特也不容小觑。

definition: to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
inferior (often in the combination 毫無遜色|毫无逊色, not in the least inferior)
to compare/to draw a parallel/to match/analogy/metaphor/comparison
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
(in the negative) (not) to be trifled with
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
